Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Customized Implants for Tibial Plateau Fractures

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised to receive either customized implants or standard medial dual plates (MDPs).

Participants.evidence: Participants aged 18â€“80 years with TPFs requiring surgical open reduction with internal fixation were included.

Intervention.evidence: Patients were randomised to receive either customized implants or standard medial dual plates (MDPs).

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to assess the feasibility and effectiveness of customized implants for tibial plateau fractures (TPFs) and compare their mechanical strength to standard implants.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the Lysholm score, measured at 12 months post-surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed using sealed envelopes.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Ten patients were randomised, with five receiving customized implants and five receiving MDPs.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The mean difference was 3.4 (95% CI 1.2 to 5.6; p = 0.02).

Harms.evidence: No adverse events were reported in either group.
